sub_title: Postdoctoral research Scientist | specializes in Complex adaptive systems | Socio-technical system design | Agent-based modeling|Disaster Communication system design | Self-* algorithms design | Value-sensitive design
summary:
I am currently involved in understanding the impact of climate change in the Terai region of Nepal and the interrelationships between river dynamics, groundwater, landcover and land use, and tigers. In this project, I develop agent-based models to investigate spatial and temporal scales and rhythms of continuity and change in river dynamics, animal behaviour, and societal routines. My main focus is to design integrated water-use strategies for communities and the wildlife living in and around Bardia National Park in a rapidly changing landscape and quantify values such as land sharing or sparing, survival.

My expertise lies in the design of self-evolving, self-healing systems with a Value-sensitive design approach. For my PhD, I designed an autonomous and self-organising mobile communication system that delivers the value of fairness, inclusion and continuity in a dynamic and disruptive environment such as disasters. I focus my work on the complex adaptive system design domain with a multidisciplinary approach to quantifying emergent values. 

I am trained as a multidisciplinary scientist, with a bachelor's in Computer Science and Engineering from the West Bengal University of Technology, India and a Master's in  Networks and Distributed Systems from the University of St Andrews, Scotland.

treasury_media.title: ‘Bij een ramp kan een klein beetje batterijvermogen je leven redden’
treasury_media.description: TU Delft-onderzoeker Indushree Banerjee ontwierp het rampencommunicatiesysteem Self-Organization for Survival (SOS). Dit SOS-systeem maximaliseert het aantal mensen dat kan blijven communiceren.

treasury_media.title: TU Delft - Self-Organisation for Survival (SOS)
treasury_media.description: The first 72 hours after a disaster are especially crucial for survival, when (inter)national rescue parties are not yet on the scene. Reliable communication is of essence for self-organized rescue. TU Delft researcher Indushree Banerjee developed a...

treasury_media.title: Nieuw zelf-organiserend rampencommunicatiesysteem kan levens redden
treasury_media.description: Een bijna lege telefoon kan bij rampen het verschil betekenen tussen leven en dood. TU Delft onderzoeker Indushree Banerjee heeft daarom een nieuw energie-efficiënt en betrouwbaar noodcommunicatiesysteem ontworpen voor smartphones. Het systeem...

treasury_media.title: Saving lives with a fair emergency communication system
treasury_media.description: Even a  low phone battery can mean the difference between life and death during disasters. With the help of TU Delft researcher Indushree Banerjee, the opportunity to communicate and be rescued is no longer dependent on owning an expensive phone with a long-life battery. She has designed a novel energy-efficient and reliable emergency communication system using smartphones, that maximizes the number of people who are able to communicate during a longer period of time.

projects.title: Developing an Educational Environments in a 3D Virtual World: A Virtual Resource for Computer Networking
projects.description: Creating a Networking science Centre which will help in active learning by the students about networks and its different evolving technology. My main aim is to develop a virtual museum for educational purpose which will demonstrate the history and development of Networks and related technologies. This project will help in creating a virtual Networking science centre that will provide interesting exhibits, multimedia displays as well as access to technical documents and standards (in progress).

projects.title: Image Steganography in frequency domain
projects.description:
•The project was for security purposes, based on image processing. There was a cover image which was sent by embedding the secret message in the actual cover image. 
•Design & implementation carried out over for 1 year. Environment & language used was Matlab 7.5 which I learned as part of this project.
•This project was mainly a research based project aimed at developing a new technique for steganography.

profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate and Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Cisco Routers and network administration).
Trained in CCNA and RHCE, involved configuration of routers and switches with protocols like IP, Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP), Serial Line Interface Protocol Frame Relay, Routing Information Protocol Version 2 (RIPv2), VLANs, Ethernet, access control lists (ACLs).
Maintained and configured LAN. Trained to install, configure, operate, and troubleshoot medium-size route and switched networks, including implementation and verification of connections to remote sites in a WAN.
Worked independently within a small team with a high level of responsibility, to ensure smooth running of the network.
